description: A simple calculator library for evaluating basic arithmetic operations. Exercises TDD workflow, vertical slicing, and clean exit detection.

userStories.title: Add two numbers
userStories.description: As a user, I can add two numbers together so that I get their sum. This is the tracer bullet â€” proves the full vertical slice works (module, function, test, commit).
acceptanceCriteria: add(a, b) returns the sum of a and b
Handles positive, negative, and zero values

userStories.title: Subtract two numbers
userStories.description: As a user, I can subtract one number from another so that I get the difference.
acceptanceCriteria: Handles positive, negative, and zero values

userStories.title: Multiply two numbers
userStories.description: As a user, I can multiply two numbers so that I get their product.
acceptanceCriteria: Handles positive, negative, and zero values

userStories.title: Divide two numbers with error handling
userStories.description: As a user, I can divide one number by another, and division by zero is handled gracefully with an error.
acceptanceCriteria: divide(a, b) returns a / b for non-zero b
divide(a, 0) throws an error with message containing 'division by zero'
Handles positive, negative, and zero dividend values

userStories.title: Evaluate a string expression
userStories.description: As a user, I can pass a string like '2 + 3' and get the numeric result, so that I can use natural arithmetic notation.
acceptanceCriteria: evaluate('5 / 0') throws a division by zero error
evaluate('abc') throws an error for invalid input
